transcripts.text: Now, we're going to be speaking to Sebastian Gorka, thanks to Betfair, our US election coverage partner, very shortly.  But first, let's have a listen to what was said and what was exchanged last night in the big debate about COVID-19.

I said, you know, this is dangerous, and you catch it.  And, you know, I caught it.  I learned a lot.  I learned a lot.  Great doctors, great hospitals.  And now I recovered.  Ninety-nine point nine of young people recover.  Ninety-nine percent of people recover.  We have to recover.  We can't close up our nation.  We have to open our school, and we can't close up our nation, or you're not going to have a nation.
And, of course, the CDC has said young people can get sick with COVID-19 and can pass it.  Vice President Biden, I want to talk broadly about strategy, though.
Can I respond to that?
30 seconds, please, and then I have a question.

No, number one, he says that we're learning to live with it.  People are learning to die with it.  You folks home will have an empty chair at the kitchen table this morning.  That man or wife going to bed tonight and reaching over to try to touch their out of habit where their wife or husband was is gone.  Learning to live with it.  Come on.  We're dying with it because he has never said, you said it's dangerous.  When's the last time?  Is it really dangerous still?  Are we dangerous?  You tell the people it's dangerous now?  What should they do about the danger?  And you say, I take no responsibility.
Let me talk about your two.  Excuse me.

I take full responsibility.  It's not my fault that he came here.  It's China's fault.  And you know what?  It's not Joe's fault that he came here either.  It's China's fault.  They kept it from going into the rest of China for the most part, but they didn't keep it from coming out to the world, including Europe and ourselves.

Donald Trump there talking to Joe Biden and saying that he admitted that covid-19 was dangerous.  Joe Biden challenging him on it, saying, well, you haven't really said it was dangerous lately.  But also the main thing.  And I think a lot of people should remember this.  Right.  This came from China.  You know, it wasn't invented in the basement of the White House.  It wasn't made in the Pentagon.  Right.  It came from China.  And Donald Trump has always said that.  And he's quite right to have said so.  Let's talk now to Sebastian Gorka, who's going to give us his verdict.  Sebastian, a very good morning to you.  Welcome.
Good morning, Mike.  What is this I hear about?  Perry Awards, the Independent Republic of Mike Graham making mistakes?  I don't believe it for a second.

It's a shocking thing.  that's put together by Martin Malagon, my brilliant producer, who somehow manages to eke out a few, you know, minor errors that I may have said over the course of the week.  It's absolutely fake news.  Thank you for sticking up for me.  Now, let's talk about fake news, because Joe Biden last night denied that he wanted to do away with fracking.  President Trump has put out a tweet rather helpfully in which he's quoted as saying that he's going to do away with fracking.

Yeah, this is.  there are a couple of kill shots during yesterday's debate in which the president did majestically.  But let's start with the prior context.  Just before the debate, a former naval officer called Tony Boblinsky said, Yeah, the Hunter Biden laptop is real.  I was the CEO of the joint venture company, and the Chinese were buying access to the White House.  And the big guy in the emails is Joe Biden, and he was taking a 50% cut.  So Just like the last debate with Hillary Clinton, where we brought the women who had been raped or sexually assaulted by Bill Clinton to the debate, to the actual site of the debate.  yesterday, there was a big upset for Joe Biden.  And that will continue because today that individual will be presenting the three phones he used in that business with all the evidence of the corruption to the Senate with regards to what happened on the debate stage.  He committed suicide.  Joe Biden committed political suicide.  At the end of the debate, he said, oh, I'm in favor of fracking.  You know, I had I've never said anything about fossil fuels being bad.  And if you've got that video, Mr.  President, put it on your Web site.  Well, we have the video.  He has said at his pathetic town halls and his pathetic.  micro rallies that we are going to get rid of for all fossil fuels.  And then at the end of the debate said, yeah, we're going to transition into sustainable energy.  Well, he just lost Pennsylvania.  He just lost Texas.  He lost all those states where we make a huge business exporting energy from America, Mike.

Absolutely right.  And of course, Kamala Harris is also on that video because she's right at the end saying, you know, yes, we want to ban Fracking is very, very clear and very plain.  And they don't seem to understand that apart from the kind of the loony lefties in California, America runs on oil.  America runs on fossil fuels.  You know, I'm always very impressed with that when I go there, because, you know, you can have as many electric cars as you like in Europe.  But that's not what's happening on 405 when I sat in a 16 lane traffic jam in the middle of Los Angeles.  I can tell you that.

Yeah, and there's another small detail.  Where do you get the electricity from?  when you plug in your Prius, when you plug in your very fancy Tesla?  Guess what?  It comes from coal-powered power stations.  And Joe Biden is the man who says, I'm the kid from Scranton.  I'm from the coal mining area of Pennsylvania.  He just lost all of those votes.  The fact is this president has done something remarkable.  I don't know if your listeners are aware of that.  In the first time ever in our republic's history, the United States, because of our allowing fracking to occur, has become a net exporter of energy.  We are selling more energy than we need, and that's great for business.  And Joe Biden just said, I'm going to kill it all.

Absolutely.  And one of the great sort of, I would say, cut throughs that that Donald Trump has managed to make in the past couple of weeks, because I think the last time you and I spoke, Sebastian, after the first debate, you know, that went well.  But then the president was sick for a while with coronavirus.  He came back from that, you know, but he was trailing in the polls.  He's coming back now in the polls.  Absolutely.  But I think this this money question is something that will trouble an awful lot of people.  You know, how do you go from being, you know, a senator on one hundred and a thousand dollars a year to a multimillionaire with a massive amount of property and with with with fingers in all sorts of financial pies and a son who appears to be some kind of business genius?

Yeah, this is the real juxtaposition between these two individuals.  And the president hit Joe Biden in the gut with this last night.  We have one individual, my boss, Donald Trump, who was a billionaire before he ran for public office and then lost money when he became president.  Not only that, in the last four years, Mike, the president has given back more than a million dollars in federal pay because he doesn't take a paycheck.  He gives it back to the federal government because he said, I'm not here to make money.  On the other hand, you've got a guy who's been in politics for 47 years on a government paycheck who has villas, who has houses, who has summer homes.  And in the first year he left office, his declared income in 2017 was $17 million.  Now, How did that happen?  And did he pay taxes on the money, the cuts that we now know he was given with those deals to China?  Did he pay taxes on those deals?  We now know yesterday, thanks to Tony Boblinsky, this naval officer who was part of those companies, a five, just one transaction.  The communist partner.  The communist Chinese partner gave the Biden family, not Hunter Biden, Mike, the Biden family, a $5 million unsecured forgivable loan.  What is an unsecured forgivable loan?  It's a bribe.  And now the Biden campaign have got to explain that for the next 11 days, and they will not have an explanation.

And well, he hasn't also really properly denied any of the accusations that have been made against him.  He's kind of done the old non-denial denial, sidestepped it, you know, said he hasn't taken money from foreign powers.  Well, that doesn't mean you haven't taken money from foreign entities, does it?

No.  And you have to read when the Blinsky press conference was held yesterday, this incredible moment.  Afterwards, the Biden campaign issued a statement.  And do you know what the wording is that they used?  Your viewers, your listeners have to check this out.  The Biden campaign after this bombshell yesterday before the debate said there is no indication that Joe Biden took monies from foreign interests.  No indication.  What does that mean?  It doesn't mean he didn't take money.  It means that we have no, we've hid it very well.  So even his campaign knows that he's in big trouble.
I have no recollection, Senator.  That sounds very much like, doesn't it?  Or indeed the great Bill Clinton line that at the time I believed I was telling the truth.  So it couldn't have been a lie.
No, no, no, no, Mike.  It depends what your definition of is is.  Yes.  Remember that one?  Of course.

Absolutely right.  Now, I've got to draw your attention to something that was pointed out to me as well.  Four years ago, the New York Times did a poll and they had the chances of winning between Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump.  Ninety three percent was the chance of winning for Hillary Clinton.  Seven percent for Donald Trump.  So, I mean, I imagine the New York Times might be trying to get a slightly more accurate poll going this year.

I have like I have saved that tweet forever and I will be using it regularly.  And there's an even better one on the night of the election in 2016.  The Huffington Post that bloody rag said that Hillary Clinton has a 94% winning and Donald Trump is a 6% chance of winning.  It's delicious.  And what's really interesting What's fascinating in all the key battleground states right now, just less than two weeks before the election, Donald Trump, my boss, is actually beating Biden.  He is ahead of where he was against Hillary four years ago.  So what does that tell you?
Well, if Biden's lost Pennsylvania, I was told by a pundit just about a week or so ago, if he doesn't win Pennsylvania, he doesn't get the White House.

Pennsylvania is really the crucial, crucial state.  And there's a real metric.  Forget the polls.  Polls are like phrenology, that fake Victorian science of reading bumps on your head.  It's a dead science.  It's a scam.  The real metric are two things, the rallies.  Wherever the president goes, and he's doing multiple rallies.  He just got off over COVID two weeks ago, and he's doing multiple rallies every single day.  Thousands of individuals waiting hours to see him.  And then Biden, whenever he comes out of his basement, he's got six people there standing in painted circles, and he's reading a massive teleprompter.  Number one, the rallies.  And number two, one that showed me in 2016 that he can win.  If you get out of the swamp, if you get out of the urban elites in Boston, in  L.A.,  in New York, if you start getting outside of London, we have yard signs in American elections, and the only yard signs you see are In real America, where the salt of the earth lives, the presidents are Donald Trump yard signs.  And that's far more telling than any poll by any company.  Yes.

Well, I heard a fascinating conversation on James Welsh the other night.  He had a pastor on a Trump supporting pastor who was talking about how one of the one of the one of the Trump organizations did a poll.  of known Trump supporters, people who had actually contributed to the Trump campaign.  They were called anonymously by this polling company who said that they were not in any way connected to Trump.  And they asked which way they were voting.  And all of these people who had given money to Trump, about 40% of them, didn't say that they were going to vote for Trump because they don't want to admit it.

There was a poll by the libertarian organization here, Cato, the Cato Institute, about two months ago.  where the respondents said 70% of us are not prepared to admit our political identity at work because of cancel culture.  So in a culture where where people have negative consequences for admitting they're a conservative, then how does polling function?  It doesn't function.  And on top of that, the campaign has been very open.  They've opened their kimono after every single rally, and they registered the people coming to the rallies.  Mike, we are seeing unbelievable figures.  Between 20% and 30% of everyone going to a Trump rally is either conservative a former Democrat or they've never voted before.  And we've brought them into the conservative fold.  That's historic.  With that kind of a silent majority, anything is possible in 11 days time.

I think absolutely right.  And 11 days is not very long.  We'll be speaking to you, of course, on the night, Sebastian, on our overnight show, because we're going to be sitting here watching and being fascinated by everything as it happens, of course.  Any last minute kind of hiccups?  Can anything go wrong?  It's still going to be pretty close, I think, isn't it?

Look, I see two scenarios, likely scenarios.  One is a neck and neck race where it's impossible because of the 80 million mail-in ballots that Democrat governors have sent out unbidden to American voters.  And because there's so many of those to be left counted on the morning of the election that they can't declare a 270 electoral college victory for either side.  And then it just goes to the courts and they battle it out in the courts.  That's a possible scenario.  But the one that's looking more and more likely is an incredible landslide for the president.  We win so incredibly that it doesn't matter how many votes are left to count in the mail-in ballots.  He goes out at 1030 at night and says, thank you, America.  I'm back.  And that's the one that we're playing for.

Well, you know, that's exactly what happened to Boris Johnson.  You know, we were being told by the mainstream media.  You'll have heard what I said earlier, that BBC News is hardly carrying any of last night's debate, which tells me that.  that tells you which tells me they think Trump won it.  Right.  But mainstream media in this country, right up until the exit poll at 10 p.m.  on the night of December the 12th, were predicting either a very close race or a possible Jeremy Corbyn win.  And Boris won with an 80-seat majority.  They couldn't have got it more wrong.
Mike, I'll just say one thing.  Jeremy who?

Indeed.  Absolutely right.  Sebastian, great to talk to you.  Thank you very much indeed.  We'll see you on election night.  Sebastian Gorka, advisor to President Donald Trump, host of America First, of course.  Get him on the radio whenever he's on.  It's fantastic stuff.  Follow him on Twitter, of course, at Sebastian Gorka.  He's a top man.
